Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Vase
Description: Small biconical vase with a flat base, narrowed neck and simple flared lip. The clay is fine, common, buff-coloured and has been polished and covered with a dark red slip that has almost entirely disappeared. A mark that resembles an offering table was carved on the shoulder of the vessel before it was fired.
